comment: This instructor left a lot to be desired.  Would not grade assignments in a timely fashion, no lecture prepared for class, review for tests was useless, and her expectations of students abilities were above the level of effort that she put in.   I do NOT recommend her.

I took her online. Worst mistake!  Graded the last 2 or 3 days of class. No chance to improve grade or get an idea of what she wanted.  Directions not  clear, and she takes off huge points for trivial mistakes. Made better grades in  science class over summer! She made the easiest class the most difficult, deducted 100 points from grade. BEWARE

One of the worst teachers I've ever had the disservice to work with. She made one of the easiest courses you've ever had during your study to feel like the worst one and in this case I'm not implying the course being hard, but her relationship and attitude towards the subject. All in all this was the worst teacher I've ever had!!! DO NOT EVER TAKE!

She grades everything WAYYYYY after the class is over, no chance to improve based on feedback. Even the feedback she gives is unhelpful. I would put my grade down, but she started grading 1 week after all the assignments are turned in, and she's only halfway done (I graduate tomorrow).
She graded all the assignments when everything was turned in . I didn't have a chance to improve my grade because she is lazy grader. I would not recommend her  to anyone

The professor is very experienced. she knows what is she teaching. But for this course you just teach yourself. in class she doesn't lecture, she asks if students have questions. if no one asks questions in the class, that will be the end of the class.

Teacher does not come with information to cover in class. Instead she will ask if you have questions about the 2 --100 page chapters she assigned the class before. If you ask questions you will feel stupid as she will start to explain them like you are a "widdle" child. Ask no questions and she will not cover anything. Teach yourself or fail.
If you pay attention and do your work, Prof Morrison is the best professor to take CS1301/1302 with. This is a class I actually learned in, not just got a grade.

She gives quizzes based on online research of the SPSU website, and some of the questions cannot be answered with certainty, almost guaranteeing 8/10. Yeah 5 question quizzes suck. Miss one and BAM you've got a B. She's also late to class, and doesn't teach much. You're expected to view PowerPoints outside of class and that's basically the course.
Very Good

She is not a pleasant person. Quickly dismisses questions as if she can't believe there was one. Literally doesn't know what we do in labs. She has the most annoying speech habits I've ever seen in a teacher.  Yeah she was always late but that's a good thing because it's 15 less min. less suffering through her brief overview of her 350 slide ppts.
She was an awful teacher. Showed up late almost every class and her teachings didn't line up with our labs at all. I do not recommend her to anyone.
doesn't even deserve your time or money! do not take her she's rude and always late....stay AWAY!!!!!

Terrible! does not need to be teaching let alone be a professor! always late, doesn't know what she's talking about half the time should have just payed you tube to teach me instead of her..... what a waste of money!!!!!!!!
worst teach i have ever had and thats saying a lot!
Never on time and is not good at explaining subject matter. I do not recommend her
WORST cse teacher. Do not recommend!

I would not recommend taking this teacher. She is consistently late and doesn't care that she is.  Also she rushes through lessons and assigns loads of useless work.  she thinks her analogies actually help when it really makes it harder to understand. Tests are hard and the grading is messed up. Would not recommend!

HORRIBLE!!!! BY FAR the WORST professor i have ever had! She doesn't know a thing about the subject, horrible at teaching it and is not a help outside of class.  She gives loads of work before she actually attempts to teach you the material needed to complete the work.  Do NOT take her she should not be a professor PERIOD!

I would not suggest this professor to those taking 1301C(Programming and Prob Solving I:gaming). Had her at 8am and she was consistently late(10-20mins every session) and had 3 absences. She speeds through lessons and just gets frustrated when you ask for clarification. Labs are inconsistent with lecture. Do not take this professor.
The best CS teacher around. Amazing professor that takes the time to teach the information and make her students understand the information.

great teacher,test were hard and graded even harder study and you will do well.She is an extremely helpful person and easy to talk to if you don't understand.To me she blew through classes and arrays which is like the most important thing in java. I never got her doughnut analogy either.
Thought the class was very well taught and fun. Labs were interesting and she is a nice professor. Interesting subject and she helped you learn it.
class sucked

Great teacher, really gets the class interested, and will constantly strive to help you with the work. There is a fair amount of work, so if you want a do nothing class, this isn't it. But if you are willing to work than you will learn a lot and enjoy the class.

I took her for both 1301 and 1302.  I was happy to have her for both because she uses simple examples and gives a lot of extra credit.  Her grading can be tough for some, but the extra credit makes up.  It was an easy A for both of her classes, but you have to do all of the work.

She's a good teacher. I dont know if you should hold it against her, but the lectures were incredibly simple--then again, it's 1301; the class is simple. Exempt the class if you can. ...I voted her down for clarity only because she uses extremely high-level analogies like "doughnuts" for classes. Maybe this helps n00bs, but it was weird to me.

Take this professor if you can! Her lectures are memorable, and she has decent office hours and is always willing to help. Tons of extra credit, but the tests are hard. Thankfully, programming assignments and labwork is a majority of the grade.

BEST TEACHER!!! Best grading system, awesome extra credit (DEFINETLY take advantage of that) andgreat atmosphere in the classroom. The only thing that I would advise is read the chapters before hand - she is a very fast talker (because she is so happy =P) and you might not catch all the information in one sitting.
EXTRA CREDIT!!!! use it wisely. Mrs. Morrison is awesome, really funny and I liked her analogies :)
She is the best teacher you will ever get the pleasure of working under.
Prof. Morrison is awesome! Very good teacher and extremely helpful. I wanted to go to class every day. The only class I have ever not skipped in college. DO NOT buy the book. It's useless.

I took 3 professors for Java and out of the 3 of them she was the only one that kept me interested.She teaches the material well, has a great sense of humor and best of all is all the extra credit she gives you a chance to achieve. Her class might not be a piece of a cake,but you simply can't go wrong by taking this lady.10/10 the whole way!

Fairly easy class, the presentations were great, but the projects and assignments sometimes seemed to be thrown together.  The labs were much more useful and relevant to the material overall than the projects.
Best CS teacher ever. She teaches very well, and you will actually learn. It is no easy "A", but she prepares you. Strongly reccommended.
WONDERFUL PROFESSOR. MAKES THINGS EASY. She uses analogies like the floating baloons for memory leaks and is amazing. I would take her again.
Excellent professor. Kept class interesting. Learned alot. Her projects can be hard sometimes, but she gives LOTS of extra credit assignments to make up for it.
Great teacher! Best I've had at SPSU.  Gives extra points for a little extra effort, and when you are finished with the course, you will know your stuff.
Hard Test, but tons of extra credit.  You need to work early on the programs, but if you put some time into the class you will get an A, and really know your stuff.
Good teacher how i learned a lot from.  her test are good but her projects are impossible to do on your on.
She was an excellent proff. Helpful, clear, and witty. She made classes entertaining, and not a chore to attend.
No Comments

Brianna was my first CS prof at SPSU and it was one of her first classes.  She was very through and helped whenever you asked.  I had her for several additional classes and she was always helpful.  Thanks Brianna  -- I finally made it!
Fast lectures. Poor teaching skills.
Great Prof!

A really good teacher. Prof. Morrison drives some people away because she goes over material so fast, but all you have to do is ask and she will help you as much as you want. Do the projects and turn them in early and you will be fine.

Of the CS professors I've had at this university, she's been my favorite.  She honestly cares about her students, and encourages them to learn.  She also knows the subject material well and provides a forum for discussion of it, not just a lecture.
Excelent professor! She is very energetic. She does a wonderful job of explaining things. She also encourages her students.
